title.narrative: CFPA MFI Gansu Revitalization and Innovation Loan

description.narrative: IFC proposes to provide a long-term debt funding of US$80 million equivalent (including US$50 million equivalent from IFCs own account and US$30 million equivalent from syndication participants) with tenor up to 5-year to CFPA Microfinance Management Co., Ltd (CFPA MF). The debt funding targets to help expand CFPA MFs lending to women micro borrowers to support the growth of the cultural, tourism, and creative service industries in Gansu Province.

The most significant expected project-level outcomes include an increase in access to finance for about 79,749 micro and very small enterprises ("MVSEs"), including about 34,722 women borrowers, in Gansu Province. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will contribute to market creation through the promotion of market inclusiveness by encouraging more market participants to replicate CFPA MF's rural MVSE lending model and to focus more on the unbanked and underbanked rural women MVSEs, particularly in Gansu Province.

mailing-address.narrative: CFPA Microfinance Management Co., Ltd. Mr. Dongwen Liu President +86-10-88578681 liudongwen@cfpamf.org.cn 18th Floor, Building A, Huangcheng International Center, 138th St. Andingmenwai, Dongcheng District, Beijing, China https://www.cdfinance.com.cn/

name.narrative: CFPA MF is headquartered in Beijing and has operation in 21 provinces in China. The Project specifically targets to support CFPA MFs lending activities in Gansu Province, China.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: O-HA - Microfinance and Small Business - Non Commercial Banking
